column4: Anyone here knows where I should look for ways to get Firefox and Thunderbird in my local language (I choose swedish on installation of ubuntu, but my browser and thunderbird (which I installed later via apt-get) is in english.
ah so I will need to do a apt-get remove firefox and remove mozilla-thunderbird first?
that will copy the bin-folder to /mnt/
do you know where I should turn to offer my help to package it for ubuntu? is it a ubuntu-group that handles that, or is it the mozilla project?
just use cp -a (as root): it will preserve times, symlinks, etc. and copy recursively
ok thx i'll have a look
yes. if you're copying a whole file system, cp -ax is the best way
aha i've never seen either the -x or the -a options. nice to learn something :o)
how did u get that entry in the menu?
it's here in hoary... isn't in warty?
but it sounds like a good idea. I can't wait for hoary to be stable.
-a: include subdirs, etc. -x: skip other filesystems. -v: report progress
just sudo nautilus in the meantime ;-)
